CatDescriptText: Miss Regina Scott, 9 Petoskey, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "Yes, if the persons they arrest are doing something wrong."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Regina Scott wearing light colored button down short sleeve blouse with bow at neckline, holding coat and striped handbag, standing at corner of Roosevelt Hotel with picture of marlin on fishing line inscribed "...cocktail lounge", on Penn Avenue with Stanley Theatre on left, Downtown
